personalInfo.name: Manish Reddy
personalInfo.summary: Backend Engineer with 3+ years of experience designing and building secure, scalable, and reliable backend systems. Proficient in system design, microservices, and data-intensive platforms. Expertise in optimizing latency, building fault-tolerant systems using Python, Node.js, and cloud-native tooling. Proven ability to work effectively in collaborative team environments and deliver high-quality software on time.

description: Built secure backend microservices integrating HubSpot via OAuth 2.0, enabling real-time CRM sync and reducing manual data handling by 70%.
Designed scalable data ingestion pipelines for complex CRM objects, improving data availability for downstream workflows by 60%.
Deployed containerized services with CI/CD pipelines, supporting multiple daily releases with zero downtime.
Improved backend reliability and extensibility by enforcing clean API contracts and service boundaries, reducing integration defects by 40%.
Designed and implemented distributed, event-driven backend microservices using Node.js, Python, Kafka, and Redis, scaling to 100M+ events/day with 99.9% uptime.
Contributed to system design for high-traffic services, including load balancing, horizontal scaling, and partitioned consumers for bursty enterprise workloads.
Implemented Redis caching and rate limiting, reducing P95 API latency by 40% and protecting downstream services from traffic spikes.
Optimized MySQL and MongoDB using indexing, async processing, and cache-aside patterns to improve throughput under peak load.
Built secure backend services with OAuth 2.0 / SSO, ensuring authenticated access, data isolation, and compliance.
Led migration from rule-based backend flows to LLM-powered services, cutting maintenance overhead by 50% and speeding up feature delivery.
Developed RESTful backend APIs using Java Spring Boot for a banking platform serving 10K+ users, reducing query response time by 40%.
Optimized database access layers and service logic, improving overall backend performance and stability.
Implemented TDD and CI/CD pipelines, achieving 80%+ test coverage and reducing production defects.
Built backend services for a learning marketplace using Node.js and Python, supporting 1,000+ active users.
Designed REST APIs for authentication, payments, and content delivery, improving transaction reliability by 30%.
Optimized MySQL and MongoDB schemas and deployed services on AWS, reducing hosting costs by 25%.

projects.name: Scalable Meeting Intelligence Platform
projects.description: Designed an end-to-end distributed backend architecture using FastAPI, Redis queues, and async workers to support fault-tolerant, non-blocking audio processing Implemented a queue-driven, multi-stage pipeline with clear service boundaries, improving throughput by 3x Built speaker-level segmentation, action items, MOM, and decision extraction, reducing manual meeting review time by 80% Applied caching, rate limiting, retries, and idempotent processing to handle partial failures and protect downstream AI services under concurrent load.
highlights: Designed a distributed backend using FastAPI, Redis queues, and async workers for fault-tolerant audio processing.
Implemented a queue-driven pipeline with clear service boundaries, improving throughput by 3x.
Built speaker-level segmentation, action items, and decision extraction, reducing manual meeting review time by 80%.
Applied caching, rate limiting, and retries to handle partial failures and protect downstream AI services.

projects.name: SimCricketX – Real-Time Simulation Backend
projects.description: Built a real-time, multi-user backend system with Flask and REST APIs, managing concurrent simulations with consistent state handling Designed match orchestration and event processing using data-driven logic and queues, reducing hard-coded rules by 50% Applied caching and consistency trade-offs to balance correctness and performance under parallel users.
highlights: Built a real-time backend with Flask and REST APIs, managing simulations with consistent state handling.
Designed match orchestration and event processing using data-driven logic and queues, reducing hard-coded rules by 50%.
Applied caching and consistency trade-offs to balance correctness and performance under parallel users.

projects.name: High-Performance URL Shortener
projects.description: Developed a scalable URL shortener using Node.js, MongoDB, and Redis, handling high read/write traffic with low latency Implemented Redis caching and optimized lookup paths, reducing database reads by 70% and improving redirect latency by 60% Containerized the service with Docker, enabling fast local setup and reliable deployments.
highlights: Developed a scalable URL shortener using Node.js, MongoDB, and Redis, handling high read/write traffic.
Implemented Redis caching and optimized lookup paths, reducing database reads by 70% and improving redirect latency.
Containerized the service with Docker, enabling fast local setup and reliable deployments.

projects.name: OpenResume – Open Source Backend Extensions
projects.description: Designed and implemented backend features for project demo links and GitHub integrations in a large open-source codebase Built an LLM-based resume tailoring backend API driven by job descriptions, reducing manual resume edits by 80% in local usage Contributed via feature development, pull requests, and issue discussions, gaining experience with real-world open-source workflows.
highlights: Designed backend features for project demo links and GitHub integrations in a large open-source codebase.
Built an LLM-based resume tailoring backend API driven by job descriptions, reducing manual resume edits.
Contributed via feature development, pull requests, and issue discussions in open-source workflows.

suggestions: Add specific examples of fostering inclusive environments or diverse teams.
Highlight experience with design thinking and data analysis methodologies.
Quantify the impact of improvements made to backend systems whenever possible.
changes: Rewrote summary to emphasize scalability, reliability, and teamwork.
Enhanced experience descriptions to include keywords like 'secure' and 'scalable'.
Reordered skills to prioritize Python, JavaScript, and related technologies.
